title: Dependent Child visa
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== (Subclass 445) Dependent Child visa This visa allows a child to stay in Australia temporarily while we process their parent's permanent Partner visa application. Personalise this page... For Applicants For Sponsors Overview About this visa Eligibility Step by step When you have this visa Overview About this visa Eligibility Step by step When you have this visa Overview From 23 July 2025, applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount. Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount. For more information, see Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications Stay Temporarily, until we have decided the permanent visa application of the parent of the child. Cost From AUD3,235.00 Processing times For an indication of processing times for this visa, use the visa processing time guide tool . This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application. With this visa the child can move to or stay in Australia until we decide on their parent's permanent Partner visa application travel to and from Australia work and study in Australia attend free English language classes provided by the Adult Migrant English Program , if eligible. See all conditions Check your eligibility The child must be a dependent child of the visa-holding parent be sponsored by the nominator or sponsor of the visa-holding parent. Help with your visa If you are getting help with your visa, before you pay someone, read information on who can help with your visa application About this visa From 23 July 2025, applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount. Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount. For more information, see Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications With this visa the child can How long the child can stay Stay longer Include other children Cost Apply from Processing times The child's obligations Travel Visa label With this visa the child can move to or stay in Australia until we decide on their parent's permanent Partner visa application travel to and from Australia work and study in Australia attend free English language classes provided by the Adult Migrant English Program , if eligible. Once the child has been granted this visa, they must apply to be added to their parent's permanent Partner visa application. When an application to add the child to their parent's permanent Partner visa application has been submitted, the child can enrol in Australia's public healthcare scheme, Medicare How long the child can stay This is a temporary visa. It starts on the date we grant the visa. The child can stay until we decide their parent's permanent Partner visa application or their parent withdraws their permanent Partner visa application. Stay longer The child can't stay in Australia longer by extending this visa. Explore your visa options Include other children Each of the child's siblings must apply for this visa separately. The child's dependent children can be included on their application when they apply or at any time before we decide the application. Dependent children of the child who apply for the visa must meet our health requirement Family members who are not coming to Australia might also have to meet our health requirement. Newborn child Find out what to do if your child is born after you apply Cost The visa costs AUD3,235.00 for the main applicant. There is also a charge for each dependent child who applies for the visa with the main applicant. There might also be other costs for health checks, police certificates and biometrics To work out what the visa will cost, use the Visa Pricing Estimator . The estimator does not take into account the other costs. Apply from The child can be in or outside Australia when the visa application is submitted. Processing times For an indication of processing times for this visa, use the visa processing time guide tool . This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application. The application can take longer to process if: it is not filled in correctly it does not include all required documents or we need more information it takes us time to verify your information you do not make full payment at the time of initial lodgement. We cannot process the application if you do not pay the correct visa application charge. If this happens, we will let you know and may return your application. You should receive an acknowledgement of your application (and advice of any associated bridging visa) within approximately one (1) month after lodgement. We will contact you using your authorised method if we need more information. Otherwise, we will contact you with the outcome of your application. The child's obligations The child must enter Australia before the date specified in their grant letter. The first entry date is generally set at 12 months from the date of visa grant. The child and any of their family members who are granted the visa must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws. See what conditions might be attached to this visa on our visa conditions page Once the child has been granted this visa, they must apply to be added to their parent's permanent Partner visa application. Travel The child can travel to and from Australia as often as they wish while the visa is valid. Time spent outside Australia does not extend the visa. Visa label We will digitally link the visa to the child's passport. They will not get a label in their passport. Eligibility From 23 July 2025, applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount. Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount. For more information, see Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications Be dependent on a parent who holds a certain visa Details The child must be dependent on a parent who holds a: Partner (Provisional) visa (subclass 309) Partner visa (subclass 820) Dependent Child visa (subclass 445) The child must apply to be added to their parent's permanent Partner visa application when they have been granted this 445 visa. If the child is in Australia, they can't hold another visa that has a ‘No further stay’ condition. Citizenship by Descent The child may apply for Australian citizenship by descent instead of a visa to travel to Australia, if: the child was born outside Australia one of their parents was an Australian citizen at the time of their child’s birth. Have a sponsor Details The child must be sponsored by the same person who sponsored or nominated their parent's permanent Partner visa application. We must approve the sponsorship before the visa can be granted. If the sponsor and/or their spouse or de facto partner (if any) have a pending registrable offence charge, we will refuse the sponsorship and visa application. If the sponsor and/or their spouse or de facto partner (if any) have a registrable offence conviction, we can only approve the sponsorship in very limited circumstances. Learn more about measures for the protection of children Be this age Details The child must be either: under 18 years over 18 years and financially dependent on the parent who has the temporary Partner or Dependent Child visa Meet the health requirement Details The child and any of their dependent children who apply for the visa with them must meet our health requirement Family members who are not coming to Australia with the child might also have to meet our health requirement. Meet the character requirement Details If the child is aged 16 years and over they must meet our character requirement We might also ask that other dependent children who apply for the visa meet the requirement. Sign the Australian values statement Details If the child is 18 years of age or older, they must: have read, or had explained to them, the Life in Australia booklet sign an Australian Values Statement that confirms they will respect the Australian way of life and obey Australian laws Have paid back debt to the Australian Government If the child owes the Australian Government money you must have it paid it back or have a formal arrangement to pay it back. Have consent to travel to Australia Details We will only grant this visa to a child younger than 18 years if either: the child has the written consent of everyone who can legally decide where they live, or the laws of the child’s home country allow them to leave their home country, or it is consistent with any Australian child order about the child Best interests of the child We might not grant this visa if it is not in the best interests of an applicant under 18. Details Meet all these criteria? Check how to apply in our step by step guide Meet all these criteria? Check how to apply in our step by step guide. Step by step From 23 July 2025, applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount. Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount. For more information, see Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications Step 1 Before you apply Check the child's passport is valid. Tell us if someone is acting on the child's behalf. Show steps Get help with your application Only some people can help you with your application. If you appoint someone to give you immigration assistance they must be: registered migration agent legal practitioner , or an exempt person You can appoint anyone to receive documents on your behalf relating to your visa matter. See how Step 2 Gather your documents Complete the forms and get the photos, documents and translations you need. Show steps Provide accurate documents Provide accurate information. See what happens if you can't prove your identity or don't provide true information Identity documents Provide the pages of the child's current passport showing their photo, personal details, and passport issue and expiry dates. Also provide: a national identity card, if the child has one proof of change of name Documents that prove a change of name include: change of name documents from an Australian Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages, or the relevant overseas authority documents that show other names you have been known by See how Photographs Provide 4 recent passport-size photos (45mm x 35mm) of the child and of any other dependent child included in the application. Photographs must be: passport-size (45mm x 35mm) less than 6 months old good quality colour. We don't accept laser copies a full-face view of your head and shoulders taken against a plain light-coloured background The child can wear untinted prescription glasses. If the child wears a head covering for religious reasons, they can show only their face. See how Character documents Children over 16 years must provide a police certificate from every country they have spent 12 months or more in the last 10 years since turning 16. We only accept National Police Certificates applied for under Code 33 – Immigration/Citizenship. The Australian Federal Police issue these certificates. We don't accept standard disclosure certificates or certificates issued by Australian state or territory police. For immigration purposes, police certificates are valid for 12 months from the issue date. If anyone included in the application served in the armed forces of any country, they must provide military service records or discharge papers. Children over 16 years must complete and provide Form 80 Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment (596KB PDF) See how Child's relationship to the parent Provide evidence the child is related to the parent, such as: a birth certificate a marriage certificate an adoption certificate a family status certificate or family book, if officially issued and maintained See how Financial documents If the child is over 18 when the application is made, provide evidence they are dependent on their parent who holds the temporary Partner or Dependent Child visa for basic needs such as food, shelter and clothing, and how long this support has been provided. Evidence could include: bank statements money transfers rent receipts See how Dependants under 18 documents For every dependent under 18 years old who is applying with the child, provide: identity documents proof of their relationship with the applicant, like a birth certificate character documents, if applicable See how Parental responsibility documents You must get consent for any applicant under 18 years of age to migrate to Australia from anyone who has a legal right to decide where the child lives. They must complete either: Form 1229 Consent form to grant an Australian visa to a child under the age of 18 years (276KB PDF) a statutory declaration giving their consent for the child to stay Australia on this visa Include an identity document with the signature and photo of the person who completed the form or declaration, such as a: passport driver’s licence Alternatively, you can show us: an Australian court order that allows your child to migrate to Australia, or that the laws of the child's home country allow them to leave their home country See how Applicants over 18 with disability Provide evidence from a qualified medical practitioner that the applicant has a total or partial loss of mental or body function that stops them from working. See how Tell us you are getting help To nominate someone to: receive your correspondence, use Form 956A Appointment or withdrawal of an authorised recipient (301KB PDF) provide immigration assistance, use Form 956 Appointment of a registered migration agent, legal practitioner or exempt person (308KB PDF) Send written notification or your forms with your paper application. See how Prepare your documents See how Translate Have all non-English documents translated into English. Provide original and translated documents in your application. Translators in Australia must be accredited by the National Accreditation Authority for Translators and Interpreters Translators outside Australia do not have to be accredited. But on each translation, they must include their: full name address and telephone number qualifications and experience in the language they are translating These details must be in English. See how Certify Provide each supporting document as a certified copy . This includes: non-English documents English translations Photographs of the applicant and any of their dependent children included in the application must also be certified. See how Keep Keep a copy of the completed application. Send Send us: certified copies of all documents as much information as possible to help us decide the application each document only once, even if you are using to show more than one thing all documents with the application, if you can See how Step 3 Apply for the visa You must apply for this visa on paper. Show steps Provide accurate information Provide accurate information. See what happens if you can't prove your identity or don't provide true information Apply on paper Complete the following form. Form 918 Application for a subclass 445 (temporary) visa by a dependent child (453KB PDF) (2MB PDF) Send it by post or by courier to the Child and Other Family Processing Centre in Perth. You must include correct prepaid postage. You must pay the application charge before you post your application. See how to pay We will not process your application until you pay the application charge. Your application should also include: proof you have paid the application charge, and all relevant supporting documents. You must complete the forms in English. If you submit your application at any other office or in any other way, it will not be valid. We will not consider invalid applications further. You cannot submit applications for this visa in person. By post: Department of Home Affairs Child and Other Family Processing Centre Locked Bag 7 NORTHBRIDGE WA 6865 AUSTRALIA OR By courier: Department of Home Affairs Child and Other Family Processing Centre Wellington Central 836 Wellington Street WEST PERTH WA 6005 AUSTRALIA If any of the above steps are incomplete, your application may be invalid. We do not process invalid applications. We will notify you if this is the case, and if requested, return your application. Do not send original documents with your application, only send certified copies . Keep a copy of your completed application for your own records, including any supporting documents. See how Step 4 After you apply We will tell you when we have received the application and documents. See what you can and must do after you apply. Show steps Importing your paper application After you or someone else has submitted your paper application, import it into your ImmiAccount. You can do this after you get your acknowledgement letter. Importing your application into ImmiAccount gives you access to online services, making it easier to manage your application. You can use our online services in ImmiAccount to: attach supporting documents to your application view messages update your details view your application status apply for a Bridging Visa (BV) withdraw your application. Follow these steps to import your application: Create a new ImmiAccount or log into your existing ImmiAccount. Our website has instructions on how to use ImmiAccount Once you log in, import your application by entering your: application ID date of birth identity document number (Passport, ImmiCard or Titre de Voyage number). For more information, see Apply and Manage your application in ImmiAccount You can import any new and existing applications for this visa made in Australia. See how Status updates We can't provide updates on the progress of the application within global visa processing times . We will tell you if we need anything further. See how Travel If you applied while the child was onshore, and the child wants to travel overseas during visa processing, they need a valid visa to return to Australia. Learn about visa expiry See how Health exams We will tell you when to arrange the child’s health examinations See how Biometrics We might ask for biometrics . We will tell you if you need to provide them. See how Send more information If you did not include all necessary documents when you applied, provide them as soon as you can. We might also ask you to provide more information. If you have imported your application into ImmiAccount, to provide any additional documents upload them into ImmiAccount. If you can’t use ImmiAccount, to provide any additional documents attach them to a completed Child and Orphan Relative Visa Processing Centre online form See how Stay lawful If the child was in Australia when the application was submitted, make sure they stay lawful by holding a valid visa while we process it. When a child applies for this visa in Australia, they are granted a bridging visa. If their current visa expires before we decide their application, the bridging visa will start. The child can stay in Australia on the bridging visa while we process their new visa application. Learn more about visa expiry See how Add family members You can add the dependent children of the child to the application at any time before we decide the application. See how Newborn children Find out what to do if your child is born after you apply Mistakes on your application Let us know as soon as you can. Complete Form 1023 Notification of incorrect answers (168KB PDF) If you have imported your application into ImmiAccount, you can use it to upload the completed form. If you can’t use ImmiAccount, attach the completed form to a completed Child and Orphan Relative Visa Processing Centre online form See how Help with your application Let us know if you no longer want someone to: receive your correspondence - complete Form 956A Appointment or withdrawal of an authorised recipient (301KB PDF) provide immigration advice - complete Form 956 Appointment of a registered migration agent, legal practitioner or exempt person (308KB PDF) For more information see Who can help you with your application If you have imported your application into ImmiAccount, you can use it to upload the completed form. If you can’t use ImmiAccount, attach the completed form to a completed Child and Orphan Relative Visa Processing Centre online form See how Tell us if things change Things you need to let us know about include: changes to the child's phone number, email, address or passport changes to the child's relationship status the birth of a child you want to withdraw the application. See how to tell us if your situation changes See how Step 5 Visa outcome The child can be inside or outside Australia when we make our decision. We will tell you our decision in writing. Keep a copy of the decision If we grant the visa, we will tell you: the visa grant number the date the visa starts any visa conditions If we refuse the visa, we will tell you: why we refused the visa whether there is a right to a review of the decision We will not refund the application fee if we refuse the application. When you have this visa From 23 July 2025, applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount. Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount. For more information, see Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications What you must do when you have this visa Coming to Australia In Australia Leaving Australia What you must do when you have this visa Once we grant the child this visa, they must apply for the same permanent Partner visa as their parent. A Dependent Child (subclass 445) visa holder must apply to be added to their parent’s permanent Partner visa application. They must do this before we decide their parent’s application. Complete and lodge the visa application in ImmiAccount Form 1002 - Application by a subclass 445 dependent child for a permanent partner visa (932KB PDF) Submit the form before we decide the permanent Partner visa application of the child's parent. This ensures the child remains lawful in Australia. To be added the Parent’s permanent Partner (subclass 100) visa application, the Dependent Child (subclass 445) visa holder can be in or outside Australia. They must be members of the family unit To be added the Parent’s permanent Partner (subclass 801) visa application, the Dependent Child (subclass 445) visa holder must be in Australia. Lodge the application by using one of the methods below: ImmiAccount Upload the application to the parent’s Partner visa application in ImmiAccount. After you have attached the form to ImmiAccount, tell us using the Partner Processing Enquiry Form Online form If you cannot upload this application to the parent’s Partner visa application in ImmiAccount, upload the completed form to the Partner Processing Enquiry Form Coming to Australia Before the child travels Check travel documents The child must have: a valid visa to enter Australia a valid passport or other travel document. At the border Complete an Incoming Passenger Card All people arriving into Australia must complete the Incoming Passenger Card Leaving the airport faster We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. Children aged 16 or over might be able to leave the airport faster using SmartGate In Australia The child and family members who apply with them must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws. You can check visa details and conditions in VEVO Tell us if things change Things you need to let us know about include: changes to the child's passport the birth of a child changes of name. See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation What you can do on your visa Check your visa conditions and expiry See the child's visa expiry, conditions and work and study entitlements in VEVO See how long you can stay This is a temporary visa. The child can stay until we decide their parent's permanent Partner visa application. To see when the child must leave, use VEVO Travelling on your visa The child can travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want while the visa is valid. Proving you have a visa To prove you have a visa and show your conditions to someone, use VEVO Request your international movement records to get proof of your travel in and out of Australia. Work and study The child might be able to work or study in Australia from the date we grant this visa. If the child works they are protected by Australian workplace law. See their workplace rights and entitlements Bringing a family member You can't add a dependant after we have decided the application. To find a visa for a family member, explore visa options Leaving Australia Before you leave Check your travel documents The child must have a valid passport or other travel document to leave Australia. At the border Leaving the airport faster We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. You might be able to leave the airport faster if you use SmartGate After you leave Prove the child has been to Australia Request your international movement records to get proof of your travel in and out of Australia.

===== main placeholder ==========================================
(Subclass 445)

# Dependent Child visa

Dependent Child visa

This visa allows a child to stay in Australia temporarily while we process their parent's permanent Partner visa application.

This visa allows a child to stay in Australia temporarily while we process their parent's permanent Partner visa application.

This visa allows a child to stay in Australia temporarily while we process their parent's permanent Partner visa application.

Overview

From 23 July 2025, applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount. Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount.For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications.​

From 23 July 2025, applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount. Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount.For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications.

From 23 July 2025, applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount. Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount.
For more information, see
Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications
.
​

#### Stay

Stay

Temporarily, until we have decided the permanent visa application of the parent of the child.

Temporarily, until we have decided the permanent visa application of the parent of the child.

Processing times

For an indication of processing times for this visa, use thevisa processing time guide tool. This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.

. This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.

- move to or stay in Australia until we decide on their parent's permanent Partner visa application
move to or stay in Australia until we decide on their parent's permanent Partner visa application
- travel to and from Australia
travel to and from Australia
- work and study in Australia
work and study in Australia
- attend free English language classes provided by theAdult Migrant English Program, if eligible.
attend free English language classes provided by the

dependent child
of the visa-holding parent

be sponsored by the nominator or sponsor of the visa-holding parent.

Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount.For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications.

For more information, see
Update to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications

## With this visa the child can

With this visa the child can
- move to or stay in Australia until we decide on their parent's permanent Partner visa application
move to or stay in Australia until we decide on their parent's permanent Partner visa application
- travel to and from Australia
travel to and from Australia
- work and study in Australia
work and study in Australia
- attend free English language classes provided by theAdult Migrant English Program, if eligible.
attend free English language classes provided by the
Adult Migrant English Program
, if eligible.

Once the child has been granted this visa, they must apply to be added to their parent's permanent Partner visa application.

Once the child has been granted this visa, they must apply to be added to their parent's permanent Partner visa application.

When an application to add the child to their parent's permanent Partner visa application has been submitted, the child can enrol in Australia's public healthcare scheme,Medicare.

Medicare
.

## How long the child can stay

How long the child can stay

This is a temporary visa. It starts on the date we grant the visa.

This is a temporary visa. It starts on the date we grant the visa.

The child can stay until we decide their parent's permanent Partner visa application or their parent withdraws their permanent Partner visa application.

The child can stay until we decide their parent's permanent Partner visa application or their parent withdraws their permanent Partner visa application.

## Stay longer

Stay longer

The child can't stay in Australia longer by extending this visa.Explore your visa options.

The child can't stay in Australia longer by extending this visa.
Explore your visa options
.

## Include other children

Include other children

Each of the child's siblings must apply for this visa separately.

Each of the child's siblings must apply for this visa separately.

The child's dependent children can be included on their application when they apply or at any time before we decide the application.

The child's dependent children can be included on their application when they apply or at any time before we decide the application.

Dependent children of the child who apply for the visa must meet ourhealth requirement.

health requirement
.

Family members who are not coming to Australia might also have to meet our health requirement.

Family members who are not coming to Australia might also have to meet our health requirement.

## Cost

Cost

The visa costsAUD3,235.00for the main applicant.

The visa costs
AUD3,235.00
for the main applicant.

There is also a charge for each dependent child who applies for the visa with the main applicant.

.

. The estimator does not take into account the other costs.

## Apply from

Apply from

The child can be in or outside Australia when the visa application is submitted.

The child can be in or outside Australia when the visa application is submitted.

## Processing times

Processing times

For an indication of processing times for this visa, use thevisa processing time guide tool. This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.

For an indication of processing times for this visa, use the
visa processing time guide tool
. This will show the processing times for recently decided applications. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.

The application can take longer to process if:

The application can take longer to process if:
- it is not filled in correctly
it is not filled in correctly
- it does not include all required documents or we need more information
it does not include all required documents or we need more information
- it takes us time to verify your information
it takes us time to verify your information
- you do not make full payment at the time of initial lodgement.
you do not make full payment at the time of initial lodgement.

We cannot process the application if you do not pay the correct visa application charge. If this happens, we will let you know and may return your application.

We cannot process the application if you do not pay the correct visa application charge. If this happens, we will let you know and may return your application.

You should receive an acknowledgement of your application (and advice of any associated bridging visa) within approximately one (1) month after lodgement.

You should receive an acknowledgement of your application (and advice of any associated bridging visa) within approximately one (1) month after lodgement.

We will contact you using your authorised method if we need more information. Otherwise, we will contact you with the outcome of your application.

We will contact you using your authorised method if we need more information. Otherwise, we will contact you with the outcome of your application.

## The child's obligations

The child's obligations

The child must enter Australia before the date specified in their grant letter. The first entry date is generally set at 12 months from the date of visa grant.

The child must enter Australia before the date specified in their grant letter. The first entry date is generally set at 12 months from the date of visa grant.

The child and any of their family members who are granted the visa must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws.

The child and any of their family members who are granted the visa must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws.

See what conditions might be attached to this visa on ourvisa conditions page.

visa conditions page
.

Once the child has been granted this visa, they must apply to be added to their parent's permanent Partner visa application.

Once the child has been granted this visa, they must apply to be added to their parent's permanent Partner visa application.

## Travel

Travel

The child can travel to and from Australia as often as they wish while the visa is valid.

The child can travel to and from Australia as often as they wish while the visa is valid.

Time spent outside Australia does not extend the visa.

Time spent outside Australia does not extend the visa.

## Visa label

Visa label

We will digitally link the visa to the child's passport. They will not get a label in their passport.

We will digitally link the visa to the child's passport. They will not get a label in their passport.

## Be dependent on a parent who holds a certain visa

Be dependent on a parent who holds a certain visa
Details

The child must be dependent on a parent who holds a:

The child must be dependent on a parent who holds a:
- Partner (Provisional) visa (subclass 309)
Partner (Provisional) visa (subclass 309)
- Partner visa (subclass 820)
Partner visa (subclass 820)
- Dependent Child visa (subclass 445)
Dependent Child visa (subclass 445)

The child must apply to be added to their parent's permanent Partner visa application when they have been granted this 445 visa.

The child must apply to be added to their parent's permanent Partner visa application when they have been granted this 445 visa.

If the child is in Australia, they can't hold another visa that has a ‘No further stay’ condition.

If the child is in Australia, they can't hold another visa that has a ‘No further stay’ condition.

### Citizenship by Descent

Citizenship by Descent

The child may apply forAustralian citizenship by descentinstead of a visa to travel to Australia, if:

The child may apply for
Australian citizenship by descent
instead of a visa to travel to Australia, if:
- the child was born outside Australia
the child was born outside Australia
- one of their parents was an Australian citizen at the time of their child’s birth.
one of their parents was an Australian citizen at the time of their child’s birth.

## Have a sponsor

Have a sponsor
Details

The child must be sponsored by the same person who sponsored or nominated their parent's permanent Partner visa application.

The child must be sponsored by the same person who sponsored or nominated their parent's permanent Partner visa application.

We must approve the sponsorship before the visa can be granted.

We must approve the sponsorship before the visa can be granted.

If the sponsor and/or their spouse or de facto partner (if any) have a pending registrable offence charge, we will refuse the sponsorship and visa application.

If the sponsor and/or their spouse or de facto partner (if any) have a pending registrable offence charge, we will refuse the sponsorship and visa application.

If the sponsor and/or their spouse or de facto partner (if any) have a registrable offence conviction, we can only approve the sponsorship in very limited circumstances.

If the sponsor and/or their spouse or de facto partner (if any) have a registrable offence conviction, we can only approve the sponsorship in very limited circumstances.

measures for the protection of children
.

## Be this age

Be this age
Details

The child must be either:

The child must be either:
- under 18 years
under 18 years
- over 18 years and financially dependent on the parent who has the temporary Partner or Dependent Child visa
over 18 years and financially dependent on the parent who has the temporary Partner or Dependent Child visa

## Meet the health requirement

Meet the health requirement
Details

The child and any of their dependent children who apply for the visa with them must meet ourhealth requirement.

The child and any of their dependent children who apply for the visa with them must meet our
health requirement
.

Family members who are not coming to Australia with the child might also have to meet our health requirement.

Family members who are not coming to Australia with the child might also have to meet our health requirement.

## Meet the character requirement

Meet the character requirement
Details

If the child is aged 16 years and over they must meet ourcharacter requirement.

If the child is aged 16 years and over they must meet our
character requirement
.

We might also ask that other dependent children who apply for the visa meet the requirement.

We might also ask that other dependent children who apply for the visa meet the requirement.

## Sign the Australian values statement

Sign the Australian values statement
Details

If the child is 18 years of age or older, they must:

If the child is 18 years of age or older, they must:
- have read, or had explained to them, theLife in Australia booklet
have read, or had explained to them, the
Life in Australia booklet
- sign anAustralian Values Statementthat confirms they will respect the Australian way of life and obey Australian laws
sign an
Australian Values Statement
that confirms they will respect the Australian way of life and obey Australian laws

## Have paid back debt to the Australian Government

Have paid back debt to the Australian Government

If the child owes the Australian Government money you must have it paid it back or have a formal arrangement to pay it back.

If the child owes the Australian Government money you must have it paid it back or have a formal arrangement to pay it back.

## Have consent to travel to Australia

Have consent to travel to Australia
Details

We will only grant this visa to a child younger than 18 years if either:

We will only grant this visa to a child younger than 18 years if either:
- the child has the written consent of everyone who can legally decide where they live, or
the child has the written consent of everyone who can legally decide where they live, or
- the laws of the child’s home country allow them to leave their home country, or
the laws of the child’s home country allow them to leave their home country, or
- it is consistent with anyAustralian child orderabout the child
it is consistent with any
Australian child order
about the child

## Best interests of the child

Best interests of the child

We might not grant this visa if it is not in the best interests of an applicant under 18.

We might not grant this visa if it is not in the best interests of an applicant under 18.

#### Identity documents

Identity documents

Provide the pages of the child's current passport showing their photo, personal details, and passport issue and expiry dates.

Provide the pages of the child's current passport showing their photo, personal details, and passport issue and expiry dates.

Also provide:

Also provide:
- a national identity card, if the child has one
a national identity card, if the child has one
- proof of change of name
proof of change of name

Documents that prove a change of name include:

Documents that prove a change of name include:
- change of name documents from an Australian Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages, or the relevant overseas authority
change of name documents from an Australian Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages, or the relevant overseas authority
- documents that show other names you have been known by
documents that show other names you have been known by

#### Photographs

Photographs

Provide 4 recent passport-size photos (45mm x 35mm) of the child and of any other dependent child included in the application.

Provide 4 recent passport-size photos (45mm x 35mm) of the child and of any other dependent child included in the application.

Photographs must be:

Photographs must be:
- passport-size (45mm x 35mm)
passport-size (45mm x 35mm)
- less than 6 months old
less than 6 months old
- good quality colour. We don't accept laser copies
good quality colour. We don't accept laser copies
- a full-face view of your head and shoulders
a full-face view of your head and shoulders
- taken against a plain light-coloured background
taken against a plain light-coloured background

The child can wear untinted prescription glasses. If the child wears a head covering for religious reasons, they can show only their face.

The child can wear untinted prescription glasses. If the child wears a head covering for religious reasons, they can show only their face.

#### Character documents

Character documents

Children over 16 years must provide a police certificate from every country they have spent 12 months or more in the last 10 years since turning 16.

Children over 16 years must provide a police certificate from every country they have spent 12 months or more in the last 10 years since turning 16.

We only accept National Police Certificates applied for underCode 33 – Immigration/Citizenship.TheAustralian Federal Policeissue these certificates. We don't accept standard disclosure certificates or certificates issued by Australian state or territory police.

We only accept National Police Certificates applied for under
Code 33 – Immigration/Citizenship.
The
Australian Federal Police
issue these certificates. We don't accept standard disclosure certificates or certificates issued by Australian state or territory police.

For immigration purposes, police certificates are valid for 12 months from the issue date.

For immigration purposes, police certificates are valid for 12 months from the issue date.

If anyone included in the application served in the armed forces of any country, they must provide military service records or discharge papers.

If anyone included in the application served in the armed forces of any country, they must provide military service records or discharge papers.

Children over 16 years must complete and provideForm 80 Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment (596KB PDF).

Form 80 Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment (596KB PDF)
.

#### Parental responsibility documents

Parental responsibility documents

You must get consent for any applicant under 18 years of age to migrate to Australia from anyone who has a legal right to decide where the child lives.

You must get consent for any applicant under 18 years of age to migrate to Australia from anyone who has a legal right to decide where the child lives.

They must complete either:

They must complete either:
- Form 1229 Consent form to grant an Australian visa to a child under the age of 18 years (276KB PDF)
Form 1229 Consent form to grant an Australian visa to a child under the age of 18 years (276KB PDF)
- a statutory declaration giving their consent for the child to stay Australia on this visa
a statutory declaration giving their consent for the child to stay Australia on this visa

Include an identity document with the signature and photo of the person who completed the form or declaration, such as a:

Include an identity document with the signature and photo of the person who completed the form or declaration, such as a:
- passport
passport
- driver’s licence
driver’s licence

Alternatively, you can show us:

Alternatively, you can show us:

an Australian court order that allows your child to migrate to Australia, or

that the laws of the child's home country allow them to leave their home country

Send it by post or by courier to the Child and Other Family Processing Centre in Perth. You must include correct prepaid postage.

You must pay the application charge before you post your application. Seehow to pay.

how to pay
.

We will not process your application until you pay the application charge. Your application should also include:

- proof you have paid the application charge, and
proof you have paid the application charge, and
- all relevant supporting documents.
all relevant supporting documents.

You must complete the forms in English.

You must complete the forms in English.

If you submit your application at any other office or in any other way, it will not be valid. We will not consider invalid applications further. You cannot submit applications for this visa in person.

If you submit your application at any other office or in any other way, it will not be valid. We will not consider invalid applications further. You cannot submit applications for this visa in person.

#### Importing your paper application

Importing your paper application

After you or someone else has submitted your paper application, import it into your ImmiAccount. You can do this after you get your acknowledgement letter.

After you or someone else has submitted your paper application, import it into your ImmiAccount. You can do this after you get your acknowledgement letter.

Importing your application into ImmiAccount gives you access to online services, making it easier to manage your application.

Importing your application into ImmiAccount gives you access to online services, making it easier to manage your application.

You can use our online services in ImmiAccount to:

- view your application status
view your application status

.

#### Stay lawful

Stay lawful

If the child was in Australia when the application was submitted, make sure they stay lawful by holding a valid visa while we process it.

If the child was in Australia when the application was submitted, make sure they stay lawful by holding a valid visa while we process it.

When a child applies for this visa in Australia, they are granted a bridging visa. If their current visa expires before we decide their application, the bridging visa will start. The child can stay in Australia on the bridging visa while we process their new visa application.

When a child applies for this visa in Australia, they are granted a bridging visa. If their current visa expires before we decide their application, the bridging visa will start. The child can stay in Australia on the bridging visa while we process their new visa application.

Step 5

Step 5
Visa outcome

The child can be inside or outside Australia when we make our decision.

The child can be inside or outside Australia when we make our decision.

We will tell you our decision in writing. Keep a copy of the decision

We will tell you our decision in writing. Keep a copy of the decision

If we grant the visa, we will tell you:

If we grant the visa, we will tell you:
- the visa grant number
the visa grant number
- the date the visa starts
the date the visa starts
- any visa conditions
any visa conditions

If we refuse the visa, we will tell you:

If we refuse the visa, we will tell you:
- why we refused the visa
why we refused the visa
- whether there is a right to a review of the decision
whether there is a right to a review of the decision

We will not refund the application fee if we refuse the application.

We will not refund the application fee if we refuse the application.

Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount.For more information, seeUpdate to ImmiAccount — new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications.

For more information, see

## What you must do when you have this visa

What you must do when you have this visa

Once we grant the child this visa, they must apply for the same permanent Partner visa as their parent.

Once we grant the child this visa, they must apply for the same permanent Partner visa as their parent.

A Dependent Child (subclass 445) visa holder must apply to be added to their parent’s permanent Partner visa application. They must do this before we decide their parent’s application.

A Dependent Child (subclass 445) visa holder must apply to be added to their parent’s permanent Partner visa application. They must do this before we decide their parent’s application.

Complete and lodge the visa application in ImmiAccountForm 1002 - Application by a subclass 445 dependent child for a permanent partner visa (932KB PDF).

Complete and lodge the visa application in ImmiAccount
Form 1002 - Application by a subclass 445 dependent child for a permanent partner visa (932KB PDF)
.

Submit the form before we decide the permanent Partner visa application of the child's parent. This ensures the child remains lawful in Australia.

Submit the form before we decide the permanent Partner visa application of the child's parent. This ensures the child remains lawful in Australia.

To be added the Parent’s permanent Partner (subclass 100) visa application, the Dependent Child (subclass 445) visa holder can be in or outside Australia. They must bemembers of the family unit.

To be added the Parent’s permanent Partner (subclass 100) visa application, the Dependent Child (subclass 445) visa holder can be in or outside Australia. They must be
members of the family unit
.

To be added the Parent’s permanent Partner (subclass 801) visa application, the Dependent Child (subclass 445) visa holder must be in Australia.

To be added the Parent’s permanent Partner (subclass 801) visa application, the Dependent Child (subclass 445) visa holder must be in Australia.

Lodge the application by using one of the methods below:

Lodge the application by using one of the methods below:

ImmiAccount

ImmiAccount

Upload the application to the parent’s Partner visa application in ImmiAccount.

Upload the application to the parent’s Partner visa application in ImmiAccount.

After you have attached the form to ImmiAccount, tell us using thePartner Processing Enquiry Form.

After you have attached the form to ImmiAccount, tell us using the
Partner Processing Enquiry Form
.

Online form

Online form

If you cannot upload this application to the parent’s Partner visa application in ImmiAccount, upload the completed form to thePartner Processing Enquiry Form.

If you cannot upload this application to the parent’s Partner visa application in ImmiAccount, upload the completed form to the
Partner Processing Enquiry Form
.

## Coming to Australia

Coming to Australia

### Before the child travels

Before the child travels

#### Check travel documents

Check travel documents

The child must have:

The child must have:
- a valid visa to enter Australia
a valid visa to enter Australia
- a valid passport or other travel document.
a valid passport or other travel document.

### At the border

At the border

#### Complete an Incoming Passenger Card

Complete an Incoming Passenger Card

All people arriving into Australia must complete theIncoming Passenger Card.

All people arriving into Australia must complete the
Incoming Passenger Card
.

#### Leaving the airport faster

Leaving the airport faster

We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. Children aged 16 or over might be able to leave the airport faster usingSmartGate.

We have an automated process that uses facial recognition technology and your ePassport. Children aged 16 or over might be able to leave the airport faster using
SmartGate
.

In Australia

The child and family members who apply with them must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws.

.

See how long you can stay

### Travelling on your visa

Travelling on your visa

The child can travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want while the visa is valid.

The child can travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want while the visa is valid.

### Proving you have a visa

Proving you have a visa

To prove you have a visa and show your conditions to someone, useVEVO.

To prove you have a visa and show your conditions to someone, use
VEVO
.

Request your international movement recordsto get proof of your travel in and out of Australia.

Request your international movement records
to get proof of your travel in and out of Australia.

### Work and study

Work and study

The child might be able to work or study in Australia from the date we grant this visa. If the child works they are protected by Australian workplace law.See their workplace rights and entitlements.

The child might be able to work or study in Australia from the date we grant this visa. If the child works they are protected by Australian workplace law.
See their workplace rights and entitlements
.

### Bringing a family member

Bringing a family member

You can't add a dependant after we have decided the application.

You can't add a dependant after we have decided the application.

To find a visa for a family member,explore visa options.
